website_summaries.verdict: With so many kid-approved apps and games at their fingertips, and the power to quickly download and smoothly play them, this is the ultimate road trip tablet.
pros: Parental controls include time limits and content monitoring

customer_reviews.title: Slow and outdated
customer_reviews.text: This is made of parts bin leftovers. It isn't the tab A released internationally in 2019. It is very slow. You'd be better off with an older, more powerful tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: No USB C or wireless charging, good image and decent tablet, Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought on the treasure truck as well, my kids have the same 2017 version. This is ok, but i wish it would have said Micro USB in description. Really should be type C in mid 2019 and have wireless charging. Other than that it's been fine for shopping Amazon and watching Netflix and playing a few games. I have a Galaxy S10+ -it's slower than my phone, but it's been a nice companion the past few days and the screen resolution is good. Adaptive brightness had to be turned off and does not work well at all. But I have had issues on my S10+ with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cinister

customer_reviews.title: Not working right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: -just after first setup the Samsung Kids apps pre installed have the message "this content isn't available on your phone anymore" -Call costumer support multiples times and no fix. -try to install the app for chrome and says that this device is not supported?! Update-- - I open a ticket in Samsung and the resolution was that because i live in Puerto Rico "commonwealth in association with the US" this app is not available in my region. I try to install the app in another Samsung model SMT350 and succeed without issues. "btw the smt350 was not rooted!"
customer_reviews.author: José luis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Painless Setup
customer_reviews.text: Once I entered my Google info, setup was simple. Asked my choice of prior devices and loaded 157 apps in bout an hour. Good screen and audio. Sure would like wireless charging. Am tempted to return and get another Nexus 7. I will give it a chance. Treasure Truck pickup easy in Whole Foods.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Beware expandable memory claims!
customer_reviews.text: What should have been a lovely tablet was seriously misrepresented in Samsung's advertising. After an online chat with Samsung's customer service, I learned that you cannot move apps to an SD card on this tablet. This tablet is heavily marketed to children, and in my experience, children download new games every day. The internal storage is nowhere near 32 GB, due to Samsung's bloatware. Shame on you, Samsung! My cheap prepaid LG phone can put apps on the SD card, and therefore is more useful. I won't buy another Samsung product.
customer_reviews.author: James Cress

customer_reviews.title: Defective screen
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective tablet. It has a yellow line down the length of the screen which I've read is a hardware problem. Called customer service and my only options were to wait a month and a half for a replacement, buy from a third party seller for more money, or buy a different brand tablet. I opted for Best Buy for the same price. If you bought this as a Christmas gift like I did, I suggest you check the product before it's too late to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Inability to reconnect to Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet would not reconnect to my Wi-Fi after 3 days. All devices in my home, tablets, phones and home automation connected and functioning. I searched YouTube and Google for solutions to no avail. VERY FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

customer_reviews.title: Memory hog, apps not moveable
customer_reviews.text: For the life of me I'll never understand why some of these brands make apps that aren't moveable to SD storage. This 8 GB device had 7 GB being used up by adware and junkware. Basically unusable and most downloaded apps aren't moveable to an SD card. 0/10 would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tech nerd

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it but it filled up and we can't have any more apps.
customer_reviews.text: We did love it, until we ran out of space and found out we can't transfer apps to the SD card. Useless. My son had 32GB of apps within the first week (mostly educational apps with reading and math games). Well now we can't have any more apps. Such regression in technology. The kids mode is awesome, the tablet works fine, but I'm so tired if technology regressing and Samsung and similar companies thinking they need to withhold features and not let us customize anything. Tried to force it to allow in developer mode and it still didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Ato

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift on Christmas Day for our 6 yr old. The product was meant to be brand new but we are completely locked out since the tablet we received has been previously logged in under another account and then not reset properly! This is clearly a refurbished item, not new as the listing claimed so now we are wasting time Christmas Day troubleshooting the item and waiting to hear back from support. Don’t waste your time with this product. Clearly incompetent seller and lies about listing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Slow and limited.
customer_reviews.text: Very slow, no compass just gps. A low end tablet useful for simple apps.
customer_reviews.author: Craig R. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: 32GB RAM? Nope. 2GB RA
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tablet based only on RAM. I need the speed and performance for recording audio and video. RAM specifications are specified as 32GB, unfortunately it only has 1.5i sh. I'm going to do a couple basic test to determine if the processing speed will be sufficient for tasks I need before I pack it up and send it back
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Meyer

customer_reviews.title: A godsend for the hearing impaired
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a severely hearing-impaired aunt (who is in her mid-90s) because of Samsung's wonderful transcription program. The microphone is most sensitive and has a wide range. Samsung's installed transcription program records and displays everything spoken to her so that she can participate in conversations, have her questions answered, hear Mass in church, etc. It's her lifeline and ensures quality of life for someone who is hearing impaired. If WiFi is unavailable, the Easy Talk Lite app works well, but the Samsung app is the best. Samsung should do more to advertise this feature of its tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mistake
customer_reviews.text: The only colors this tablet has are pea green, army green, brown and black. There are no other colors for ANYTHING
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Thrasher

customer_reviews.title: Micro USB cable issue
customer_reviews.text: The device came with a stiff USB cable with Micro USB adapter. Both did not couple well (cheap!) so I ordered a micro USB cable since it wouldn’t charge with other cables I had around. My mistake, but first and only Samsung device I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Danville Lee

customer_reviews.title: The turtle and the hare ran laps around this tablet
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so annoyingly slow. Plus the sd card capability is virtually worthless at this point since you can't move apps over to the card easily. Oh and micro sd. No rapid charging. I get it's not a 600 dollar tablet but you can get this capability on 150 dollar options. Bottom line, in this day and age there is no reason for a ~150-200 dollar tablet to be so ungodly unresponsive. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Py

customer_reviews.title: Its fast for its price range.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a tablet for work that wasn't expensive. I'm a Samsung addict(note 10,watch active 2,Samsung buds ect). This is not the best by far. However its fast and does the job perfectly. I'm honestly impressed with how it handles at this price. My only gripes are no haptic feedback and the dual speakers (sound great)but are not separate(so lose that stereo sound)why Samsung? Especially with Dolby atmos.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Jensvold

customer_reviews.title: Fast and solid build!  Great for professional use!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet. Better than the $100 walmart tablets for sure. Feel nicer in the hands and hold up much longer. We use them to program BT equipment in the field. Bought 4 of them so far and they all are working years later.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Waters

customer_reviews.title: Laggy with poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Laggy with a wifi connection that drops on a daily basis. Returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out - No Mirroring or Apps on CF Card
customer_reviews.text: I didn't do my due dilligents and read the reviews carefully. I went to cast a read along kids book to the TV on this new device, and was dumbfounded that there was no cast button like every other android tablet that I've ever used. Miracast is just a standard android feature now... it must have been intentionally removed for product line segmentation. I had also told my wife, "Don't worry about the 32GB of memory, Samsungs are great, they come with CF card slots so you can just add more memory." Well I found out from reviews that Samsung disabled the ability to run apps off the CF card also. Bunch of BS Returning tablet
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The tablet does not charge.
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my worst purchase. After a few weeks it stopped charging. There was no option provided for this product to be returned. I am now stuck with a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: paulagaye pratt

customer_reviews.title: Not Kid Friendly....My four year old broke this within 30 days of receiving it
customer_reviews.text: Not Kid Friendly....My four year old broke this within 30 days of receiving it. It should be noted he plays on our smart phones, the house tablet, Grandma's touch screen laptop, and has his own personal Amazon Fire Tablet that he has had for over two years. None of these broke. However, this Samsung POS lasted less than 30 days. We are calling Samsung to see if there is anything they can do. We will update acvordingly. Highly disappointed and $150 wasted. Update: Spoke to Samsung, for $179.99 they can fix the $129.99 tablet. Extremely disappointed. Suggested they remove the work Kids from the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No support for AC Wi-fi protocol
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Galaxy Tab A Kids Edition 8”, 32GB WiFi Tablet Silver (2019).Tablet doesn't support ac wi-fi.It works on 5db radio but only set to mix signal (ac,n)There is a mistake in specs description.
customer_reviews.author: mariusz konopski

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is really slow relative to iPads. I don’t know if it’s android or if it’s just you get what you pay for. I’ve heard this tablet is much better than others priced similarly, but it doesn’t compare to a $600 device
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Wisner

customer_reviews.title: Slow, touchscreen terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Nexus 7 whose battery had died. Although benchmarks will say it's faster than the Nexus 7 (BARELY), it certainly doesn't feel like it. The battery life isn't very good. The touchscreen is pretty bad. The display resolution is ok, but not great. Can't someone make a decent 7-8" android tablet? I don't want an iPad at all, but dang, kinda getting pushed that way.
customer_reviews.author: KYLE

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy. Get it now!!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is so awesome and for the price??! Its so worth getting. I was hesitant because the price was so good I thought, "How good could it really be?" But there were so many positive reviews and I desperately needed a new tablet, so I decided to go for it. And I'm so glad I did because this tablet is literally the best. I've never had an apple iPad or anything like that, but I have used my mom's several times before. This tablet, in my opinion, performs just as well as the more expensive options out there. I've owned this for several months now and it's just absolutely amazing. Perfect for all ages. Love, love, LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: rainydaze

customer_reviews.title: But it
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Easy to use. I love the kids home option. I bought this for my autistic 7 year old and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Grandma
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet for my grandma so I can video chat with my grandma when she goes back home. It works like a charm. It's easy to use, small, and efficient. I love that it's up to date, so I don't have to worry about the next update being supported by the device. It was easy to set up, and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Aleaf

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang good.
customer_reviews.text: I was searching desperately for an affordable alternative to my Nexus 7. Mainly, I really liked the size of the Nexus 7. I got this because it was roughly the same size. Unfortunately, the ratio is a little different and it was a little wider than I wanted. That was on me though, so I can't really drop a star. For this price, it's a pretty dang good tablet. I will probably use it to distract the kids every once in a while. Pretty good for streaming stuff on too. It's plenty pretty and responsive. Not sure I am digging this version of Android so much but it's not making me angry either.
customer_reviews.author: JACK A. LOPE

customer_reviews.title: A perfect kid's tablet!!
customer_reviews.text: After getting my daughter an Amazon Fire Kids Tablet two years ago, we knew she would "outgrow" it soon. She had so many favorite apps from the Google Play store that she couldn't play on her tablet, so we "upgraded" to this tablet. She is so happy! Even though this is our second time buying this tablet (she ruined the charging port), it is still worth the money. Do recommend getting a kid-proof case and a screen protector. The case that comes with it isn't great at all. Maybe even a magnetic charging cable for more ease of charging.
customer_reviews.author: Ai Kazama

customer_reviews.title: buy the adult version and download samsung kids
customer_reviews.text: great tablet, however the case is useless. My kid needs one with handles at the side so he can hold it and not press the buttons on the touch screen and pause sesame street, but its not available anywhere from any retailers. This would definitely have affected my desire to purchase this item had i known in advance. You can have adult mode and kids mode. I wasnt going to pay for a subscription so i had to download ordinary samsung kids instead of using the preinstalled software. I feel like it wasnt worth even buying a kids version. I should have just bought the adult version and used a different case.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael G.

customer_reviews.title: Micro-USB in 2019? No!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Micro-USB in 2019? When the 2017 version had USB-C? Really? Sent this back. I didn't even think that it could be this bad. Just no.
customer_reviews.author: M Bova

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old model. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: My old samsung tablet stopped charging after a few years, and my fairly new tablet is garbage. It takes 10 minutes to load up the Kindle app. I wanted one the same as my old one to make sure it does what I need it to do and do it quickly. The new one is slightly smaller than my last one and super thin and light. I can shove it in my back pocket. The picture quality is great and it'll even play a game I couldn't comfortably play on the old one. I love it. I'll probably get one for my mom for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Bikerdlp

customer_reviews.title: Hot garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I love Android and have a Samsung phone. Immediately after the tablet was done being set up it was glitchy. I would press on an app and could count to 8 before it would open up. Couldn't even scroll through Twitter properly without it freezing. I did a factory data reset on it thinking maybe something got messed up during the activation process. Nope same exact thing. I immediately returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Squeaky Squid

customer_reviews.title: Great kids tablet without all the limitations.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my 3 year old daughters tablet. Her lat one was very dated and most apps werent compatible with it. We are a samsung galaxy family, so we wanted to buy a device we would know how to navigate. I was able to link my google acct to her new tablet with no issues. It runs very smoothly. No hiccups thus far. I love that it is a kids tablet, but can still be fully functional. Issues with other kid tablets is that there may br a lot of limitations. This tablet doesnt have those. This tablet will in no doubt grow with our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Cannot move apps to an SD card
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good tablet. The battery runs down too fast. The touch screen is too sensitive. What gives it 2 stars is the fact that after I purchased and installed an SD card I found out that Samsung took away the ability to put your apps on the SD card. My device is running out of space and I have an SD card that's empty. This is beyond disgraceful!. This is the last time I purchase anything from Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Mackazey X19X

customer_reviews.title: Sloooooooow...
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously, the slowest mobile device i have ever used. Just to type this review, it was a 3 count from when I clicked the text box to when the keyboard showed up. It took 13 seconds to load the Amazon app. Forget about Chrome.but, the battery lasts for 2 weeks for what I use it for, as a reader. And it very slim and easy to hold, so I couldn't give it 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Loving

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller screen
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller screen than a Galaxy Tab A 8in display Item model number SM-T350 That we received this last May. Both tablets side by side the new one you get significantly narrower view
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: ITS WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS THE BEST BUY DURING COVID . FROM THE DAY MY SON GOT THIS TABLET. IT HAS GIVEN HIM MANY HOURS OF ENJOYMENT, I LIKE THAT I CAN CONTROL WHAT HE DOWNLOADS. I ALSO LIKE THAT I CAN DELETE ANY THING I DONT AGREE ON I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TABLET. ESPECIALLY SINCE AS HE GETS OLDER I CAN JUST MAKE THE PARENTAL CONTROLS GROW WITH HIM.
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these now and both led screens cracked within in a week of purchase. Not the clear glass digitizer screen but the led screens. I don't know if they are ultra thin or just poor quality glass but the durability of these units is a let down. Both screens were cracked when in a protective cover. Love the rest of the unit but if it breaks at the drop of a hat they don't get a very high rating from me.
customer_reviews.author: stillkickn

customer_reviews.title: I'm Done with Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Expandable to 512gb but you can't move ANY apps to the SD Card. WHY? I bought a 512gb card, and half of my internal 32gb is filled with apps I can't move. I feel like I got screwed twice! I don't use my tablet as a camera, or for music. What's the point of the SD Card, if I can't use it for anything but pics & music?
customer_reviews.author: MDPantherfan

customer_reviews.title: Micro sd card doesnt work in kid mode
customer_reviews.text: My child has a amazon fire and i got her this tablet so she has access the play store as well as being able to use a micro sd card to see all her movies and store her apps. They dont tell you that restrictive profiles (your kid's profile) cannot use the sd card. So any movie saved or app stored on the sd card can only be used on the adult profile, not your child's!! This defies the complete idea of a child's tablet. 14GBs of the 32GBs are used by the tablet to function. So my child only has 16gb to store all apps, movies, and music!! I might have to return it. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I but this tablet for my daughter's 23 birthday. For the price it's worth beyond. Good screen quality perfect size easy to set up. Play For games, movies, or homework. Easy to use for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Chavira

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive Tablet w/ GPS
customer_reviews.text: The Q&A and the Spec list are misleading. It most certainly does have GPS. What it lacks is a sensor to turn the screen on or off based on your case cover being opened or closed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 4 year old and he loves it, and I like the fact that I can limit what he sees and how much time he's on it.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Panther

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST PURCHASES EVER
customer_reviews.text: Had tried two other tablets and was not happy with them. But as they say, third time is the charm and the Samsung Galaxy Tab A is a JOY!! Was able to set it up and use it from the get go. Like the fact that it as 32g of storage and you can add an SD card. It is FAST! The screen is clear and the colors and vivid and bright! The battery last a long time. I use specifically to do Paint By Number apps and I am happy with how it works. CANNOT provide more tech stuff than what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of a refurbished i-Pad and a quarter as good (at best)
customer_reviews.text: We bought the kids' version for our 6-year-old was unimpressed. The screen brightness could not be easily adjusted, and the brightest setting was still too dark with some apps. Navigation was un-intuitive. It's as heavy as it is slow. We don't spoil the kiddo with toys and gadgets, and he still set it aside and forgot about it. I forgot about it, too, until I realized we still hadn't returned it. Now it's too late and I'm consoling myself by writing this review so that others might avoid my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: I. Mikhalevich

customer_reviews.title: I’d even use this myself
customer_reviews.text: This tablet worked perfectly as expected for our 7 year old son. We have all the streaming services (Netflix, Hulu, sling, Amazon, Disney plus), plus all his game apps: Minecraft, etc. He’s dropped it a few times and thankfully the bumper has protected it. The only thing I don’t like is the bumper is missing a kickstand (to help prop it up)
customer_reviews.author: NE Ohio - USA Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Limited ability
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great for its size It’s still a struggle to connect an external device that the iPad could not do
customer_reviews.author: Benny B.

customer_reviews.title: CHOPPY VIDEO-impossible to watch streaming videos and TV.
customer_reviews.text: A total waste of money. I couldn't watch youtube, no netflix or other streaming videos due to poor video quality that made the video appear scrambled. It wasn't my WIFI connection either because video streaming was fine on my other 2 three year old Galaxy's.
customer_reviews.author: Toni D

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have an android tablet for use with a couple android only apps. Need to project to a screen while using them but this tablet does not have screen mirroring. Basically useless for the reason I bought it. I don't personally like the Android OS, there are way to many versions and very difficult to get specific device questions answered. I am exclusively Apple normally but even so this tablet is slow and the touch screen is rather unresponsive when compares to a "Base Grade" iPad. If you need a cheap, dependable tablet just for simple internet, social media and entertainment I guess this one is OK, but I will likely be giving this one away.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: There are better options than this
customer_reviews.text: The sole reason this tablet was purchases was to play Clash Royal, Clash of Clans, and stream Netflix. Three simple tasks this tablet FAILED to complete. Despite updating the software for both the system and all the apps, there was far too much lag that ruined the experience. Since only three apps were installed, storage was not an issue. The issues don't end there, the screen was a bit off, as i was typing for some reason it would detect that i tapped the same letter a few times. I have been been using Samsung products for years, and I'm honestly extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Husam Razick (Sam)

customer_reviews.title: Good Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The touch feedback is not the most sensitive. I have no screen protector on it yet. Also this needs to say it is the kids version though I am unsure why beyond Kid's settings that are available as all things have. I bought is for myself as this is a tablet to me anything larger is too bulky. This is heavier than I expected. The battery life is good but I don't play games on it. Use it for YouTube or Beachbody or web research/reading. The camera and video quality are not the best which is annoying. I always would rather have Sansung versus Apple as it is far superior and better priced.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: We like the Galaxy line from Samsung. We bought these for our 2 son's for school. I will be homeschooling them so they needed something since most of their assignments are online. They came well packaged and work great. I have it set up with Google's Family Link so they are very limited to what they can do. But the product is great and does exactly what it's suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Saucier

customer_reviews.title: Just for little little kids.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 10 year old. Thought it was a tablet with a fun accident preventing case. Nope. It's entire system is based on a separate OS than a normal galaxy tab. Changing this to a normal tab will be a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: C0SM0 SIX5

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced, Slow
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Tab A 8.0 (2019) I got this to play Eve Echoes, doesn't even show up in the store for this model. It was extremely laggy during setup and the screen looked awful, washed-out color, like a laptop from the 90s. This would be ok for a 50 dollar tablet but this cost way too much money for what you get. I returned this and hope to find another, expected more from Samsung for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Quality Samsung Tablet
customer_reviews.text: At this price point ($149), this is an excellent choice for an 8" wifi tablet. This model has a 32gb drive and a pretty speedy processor, and it runs Android Pie out of the box. Samsung makes quality products anyway, but again at this price it's a no-brainer. I expect to get some good years out of this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Super Clear Screen
customer_reviews.text: This is really a fast tablet and perfect for the little ones. Very easy for them to hold on to. The screen was extremely clear and the speed of the machine is very fast. I can watch a video on Netflix without any kind of slow down or hesitation. If you are looking for a tablet to help educate your children and in some cases to hold their attention, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: jofaone

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: I’m using it as a control device for a Mevo plus streaming camera. The screen feels like my iPhone. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Art M.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure I got a poorly done refurbished tablets when I paid for new. Can't open some apps. Attempted factory reset and got a 'contact your manager' error. Received 6/19. Packaging up to return 6/20.
customer_reviews.author: amlohss

customer_reviews.title: A great kid's tablet at a good price
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and safely- the only issue is that it appears to not have come with a USB cable at all, which is odd since it was sealed when I received it. (Everything else was there, and it is clearly brand new.) Set up was as painless as possible, it runs fast enough and has enough memory to meet our needs, and my 7 year old is adapting to it well coming from her old Samsung tablet (which is bricked due to a bad charge port.) We haven't had any issues yet, and given my familiarity with and trust in Samsung products, I don't foresee having any issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AbnormalZombieBaby

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good budget tablet. It's zippy and can run most apps. My kid has a Fire 8 which is waaaay slow and is generally unuseable for anything other than reading Kindle books and streaming Prime video. I had an Asus ZenPad prior to this and that had a great screen and performance, but then it started hard-crashing for no reason and the problem continued after a factory reset. In conclusion, Asus is garbage and so is the Fire. The Galaxy Tab A is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: jonathon schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tablet. Everything works great. Have had no problems. Screen is clear. Battery life is great. Rarely runs out of battery before the end of day even with kids playing it all day. Charges quickly. We've had it for over 2 months now. The perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: JHarker

customer_reviews.title: Can't transfer apps to memory card
customer_reviews.text: Saw a review from a person about being unable to transfer files from internal memory to memory card and tried it and its so so true! Tried all how but its impossible to transfer apps to memory card. Makes no sense having a memory card slot if you can't add apps to a memory card! Good thing I have another tablet. So if you plan to transfer apps to memory card this is not the tablet for it
customer_reviews.author: Andre Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: I had for less than a week, and it has a lot of problems.
customer_reviews.text: Had this this for 6 days, and there's so many problems. It's extremely slow, some apps take days to load, while they work just fine on other devices. The charging takes forever. And the charger sucks, I already have to twist it around the tablet for it to charge. I'm disappointed. I didn't want to return this one and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: UmmAyoob

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: It is a great tablet although I did have an issues with the touchscreen being overly sensitive. Setting for adjustment would not fix it{possible hardware issue} I am returning it & getting a replacement one. But over all for the price It is an excellent tablet. I would have even bought it at the $150 list price. Got this one for $119 Samsung has always had great products.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLady

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So the tablet came in mint condition which I was happy about. But only was able to use it for one day before it stopped working. After an update from the tablet itself prompted a message to come up that read tablet was no longer working needed to be sent in to be fixed. Turned it off and back on again that’s the only message that pops up on the screen does not let you move past that screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good budget tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my 2013 Google Nexus 7. Considering the price point, it have acceptable performance and does its job as expected. Battery last all day for me. I play mostly mobile Supercel games (Clash of Clans, Boom Beach). Was considering an iPad, but I needed a tablet that can easily swap between gaming user accounts. This does the job. I have four user accounts setup on this tablet. All works good.
customer_reviews.author: Mysteri0

customer_reviews.title: Internet Capability Not Working
customer_reviews.text: Very, very disappointed in this product. From the moment it was first turned on, this pad could not maintain a continuous internet connection despite our strong in-home wi-fi signal. It would only connect manually, and couldn't retain the wi-fi password. We have been a Samsung family for about 15 years, but this Samsung tablet and our last one have not performed well. I'll be shopping for a non-Samsung replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to replace the same model (older) that our kids had previously run into the ground after several years of daily use and within a couple months we have a cracked screen. I am inclined to blame it on the new model because I don't feel that this has gotten any abuse that the other two hadn't had over and over again with the previous model. Super bummed out and will probably go with a cheaper fire tablet in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lc89

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had the tablet 9 months and I've been perfectly happy with it. It is a little slow compared to my phone, but I was expecting that. I had exchanged a no name tablet that didn't work straight out of the box for this, so I guess my expectations were a little lower. The one I have takes an SD card but I haven't needed one because I haven't really downloaded a whole lot. All in all, I've been happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: p3rachel

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware-register with Samsung US.  Mine is international & ineligible for US warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Samsung tablet but it is an international version which does not qualify for the 1-year U.S. warranty. I was sold a SM-T290NZSAKSA - an international Saudi Arabian Samsung tablet - not a SM-T290NZKAXAR. When I tried to register it...and read off my product serial number, it was ineligible was the U.S. Warranty! The Samsung rep told me that AXAR at the end means it is a US product....AKSA means that its an international product. I'm sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: Textilady

customer_reviews.title: It is not an improvement from what i purchased 8 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I got this new tablet exactly the same size, just much newer version and was disappointed to find out it was not an improvement or advancement from 8 years ago version. The only thing is better is battery life. It is still slow. the touch screen is terrible. i get so frustrated, that i do not use more features, beyond facebook and reading ebooks. For this price i can tolerate shortcomings, but will never buy Galaxy tab again.
customer_reviews.author: Inna Glazman

customer_reviews.title: Bad Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I got it at a good price for my retirement. I tried several times to get into it, but the safe mode button is stuck inside the tablet. I took it to the Geek squad and my own IT guy and they both said the same thing. It has to be fix from the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Brumley

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Still uses micro USB charger. Can't use SD as internal storage. Can't connect to phone for text, only 720 HD not full. No wireless charging. But still I'm giving it 3 stars. Its not to slow for only 2 gig ram and the quality seems good. For the price not bad but thinking Im paying for the galaxy name. If I had to do over would have bought a kindle or off brand tab with better specs.
customer_reviews.author: Cbaracuta

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but still feels over priced.
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s cheaper than the entry level iPad, but it still feels over priced. Everything is budget level and it feels even worse. Slow. Laggy. Poor screen. Awful colors. Samsung bloatware. Random WiFi connection loss. Really bad stuff. I’d recommend a used iPad from eBay over a brand new tab A.
customer_reviews.author: sgun73

customer_reviews.title: Galaxy Tablet A, 2019 a nifty gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose for personal use; email, search the internet. Very handy, but not very big. Wish I could have bought the 10" instead, but it does what I needed it to do. Takes great pictures! Nice little gadget for a not a big price very.
customer_reviews.author: Gran2

customer_reviews.title: good travel or casual tablet
customer_reviews.text: You must register online to avoid major hassle down the road if you have a warranty issue. Based on the grandkids unit, they are weak, warranty service said we had invisible damage to the screen which voided the warranty. Rubber bumper is suitable for adults but not children. Have used it on a couple trips for email, movies, wifi with no immediate problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lee in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say its Samsung - they deliver as expected. Arrived on time, in great condition and the actual tablet is better than I expected. This is my first "real" tablet all my others were simple audio readers and email checkers, I bought this tablet to run Marvel Future Fight and to video call my family during Corvid-19 stay at home, and I can say its been one of the best "selfish" purchases I have ever made. I have started using my tablet for so many other things now and its became my personal assistant.
customer_reviews.author: tjstop

customer_reviews.title: great tablet
customer_reviews.text: it took a little bit of time to get used to this tablet (we have always used the really cheap ones before), but now that we know what we are doing, it is very easy to use . I would recommend getting an additional micro SD card for more storage
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: My kid loves this tablet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply parental controls to this device by setting up a google child account and loading it onto the device, then download family link to set control parameters. My kid is loving the freedom to download google play store apps and games that weren't available to him on his fire tablet that he got last year. Needless to say this is his new favorite toy and he chose it over Robux :)
customer_reviews.author: QA Manager, Elias

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade from the last Tab As' we had. I don't like these ones at all. I don't know why they would take away the type c charger. It takes longer to charge tbh. I bought 2 for my kids and I had to get new chargers for both of them too because they would have trouble plugging them in. Touch sensitivity does seem a little off too. I am actually very disappointed. This felt more like a downgrade
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Very basic
customer_reviews.text: For what this tablet is, it is pretty good. With this price point I think it's the best small budget tablet out there. It is a bit slow at times and can't really run too many tasks at the same time. But just for basic use like Netflix, YouTube, internet browsing this does that well. Less than $200 I think it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Evan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge step up from his tabA6. Lots more memory, better graphics, loads quickly. My son is thrilled with this... and now I wish I'd bought one for me too. But the updates took FOREVER, especially considering this is a new release tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Carriebella

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Christmas gift and after barely 2 weeks of use, it will not charge. We've tried several cords, none of which will charge this tablet and yet the cords charge other devices perfectly fine. I do not recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Terra law

customer_reviews.title: Why no USB-C in 2019?
customer_reviews.text: The 2017 model has USB-C. I wanted this as a replacement but reverting back to a less durable micro USB is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod

customer_reviews.title: Tablet review
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is for basic computing needs (that is, surfing the internet, checking e-mails, and watching videos). The screen quality is mediocre and the touch screen is passable. You should purchase this tablet if only you are short on cash; if money is no object, it is best to purchase a more substantial tablet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I Like SamsungTablets
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8" Samsung tablet myself and decided to get one for my husband. Very pleased with this newer version. The battery lasts a little longer than an earlier version. Screen quality is good. Now we can each listen to and watch what we are interested in. He uses his to read books from the local library. Very easy to set that app up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got this for the parents. After some trial and error it works great.
customer_reviews.text: The only issue this has is that the touch screen is a bit randomly sensitive. I went with samsung as it's a device company they are comfortable with and threw the launcher on it that they know how to use so that there is no learning curve. Seems very responsive when loading or playing youtube which is their main use.
customer_reviews.author: M_Leon246

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet for 4 days and it is almost 100% a piece of crap. Power and volume buttons work only when they want, which is practically never, getting the tablet to "wake up" is a joke, and there are plenty other issues not worth bringing up because they won't be rectified. I'll stick with the Amazon Fire, it's a much better product and value.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is heavy. Its not very responsive either. Im not a big fan. The last one I had was awesome but I wasn't even sure this was a Samsung at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy a white tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. Its everything I was hoping for. Being that its white, the 2 front cameras stand out as two unattractive black circles. To me they're a negative distraction . They seem like eyes . I think its a manufacturing flaw. That is my only small complaint about this product , and I also learned a lesson: never buy a white tablet.
customer_reviews.author: big fish

customer_reviews.title: Bad device and bad support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this only over a month and the device is getting into infinite restart. Now. I have to work with Samsung support to get this repaired. First, I just bought this just over a month ago, should they send me a new one instead of waiting for this? Secondly, Samsung support is terrible, they have all my contact information, but they said they cannot reach me and blame on of lack of communication! Well, they can text me, but they never left voice email plus they have my email, why don’t attempt to reach me by email!
customer_reviews.author: Thatri Osothsilp

customer_reviews.title: Works for phantom 4 Pro DJI Go. Laggy for everything else.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I’m just spoiled from using high end tech but this feels laggy and unresponsive. Tapping takes longer, unlocking takes longer, opening apps takes longer... it all just takes longer. When apps open or close, they aren’t smooth. They stutter in and out. It works great for my Phantom 4, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does not screen mirror with Samsung TVs
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with new Samsung SmartThings App and Samsung has end of life Smart View. The only reason I bought this was to screen mirror on a Samsung Smart TV which I can not get to work.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. Sure other tablets are more expensive but the touch screen is often not sensitive enough for it to notice my tapping, battery life is relatively short. Spend more on a better tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Mint

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: It is a budget tablet. Sometimes it is slow to load but good for the money and performs fairly well. The battery life is much longer than expected. I bought the 10" one for my dad it runs a little bit better and has samsungs smartview built in. This one is a little more basic but really nice to use for browsing and watching videos. And the occasional casual game.
customer_reviews.author: Mychelle

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for - a slow, functional samsung tablet. Great for letting the kids watch movies on with nothing serious risked.
customer_reviews.author: BeastInside

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice tablet if you don't use kids mode and buy a better case
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my toddler. We didn't like the Samsung kids mode at all. It could potentially be great for some, we were just very unimpressed and felt the software was clunky and far too limited. The case that it comes in is awful for kids.. it is very thin silicone so it provides very little protection for the screen area. The tablet itself runs great. We uninstalled kids mode and just paid a ton for apps from the play store. More expensive up front but I think it will be the best for us in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I always want my electronics to have everything and be instantaneous, but I can't afford the ones that are. Considering what I paid for this it is very nice. It is hard for me to judge battery life, I do tend to get stuck on it playing games for hours, so I do need to plug it in at least once a day.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Casterline

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy Tab A Kids Edition 8”, 32GB Wifi Tablet Silver (2019) - SM-T290NZSKXAR
product_meta.description: Style:Kids Edition| Color:SilverEntertain kids with a tablet built just for them. The highly engaging interface features curated kids’ content so they're always excited to come back for more. Parental control features let you monitor screen time and access to content. With a rugged bumper case to protect against drops and a long-lasting battery for uninterrupted entertainment, The Galaxy Tab A kids Edition has what it takes. Design CMF: Unibody Aluminum. Bluetooth v4.2.
feature_bullets: Designed for discoveries Samsung kids gives little ones their pick of over 10, 000+ hours of kid-friendly activities, featuring the characters kids love. Get a free trial of Samsung kids with purchase 1
Their world; Your rules rest easy knowing your kids are interacting with content you can trust. Plus, set time limits, and monitor what they're watching.
Safe in small hands: Made for little hands, the 8. 0" Galaxy Tab a kids Edition Includes a durable bumper case to protect against bumps and drops.
Kid-level energy included with up to 13 hours 2 on a full charge, kids can browse, play educational games or watch a movie without recharging.

specifications.Wireless Type: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth, 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Series: Samsung Galaxy Tab A Kids Edition 8”
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,797 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
